item.title: 29 Oct 2025 10:30
item.description:
Reorganized my Trilium Notes a bit. Over time I started dumping notes in there and somewhere it all went a bit wayward. I really need to start using it as a proper knowledge base. The good thing is most content that I refer to frequently is all in there. This along with my Signal ‘Note-to-self’ are my go-to spaces.

I’d like to read more blogs that are not tech related. Mostly driven by my curiosity in the tech space, I’ve somehow gotten into this bubble of tech-adjacent blogs. Would be nice to pop out a bit. Maybe I should explore powRSS a bit? I’ve also noticed I lean towards people who have their own personal domain. Maybe it’s a sign of some sort of commitment towards actually owning their writing?

Thinking if I want to get a nice digital sketch book. Or I should just re-purpose that old kindle? There are times I just don’t want to ‘write’. Some things are probably better just sketched out. I’ve tinkered with the Sketches app before. Maybe i’ll just port that over to the kindle one of these days…

Google seems to be making all moves to prevent sideloading apps in Android. I think it’s time I shift gears and look at other alternatives out there.

Zen browser looks real neat. Should give it a spin one of these days.

Nothing like a mildly thawed frozen Papaya…ðŸ”—

item.title: 24 Oct 2025 21:30
item.description:
It’s friday night and Magno has their regular DJ blasting music downstairs by the restaurant. My room is right above the restaurant and there’s zero sound proofing. I plug my earphones in and turn on the noise cancellation. Works just as it is supposed to. It’s been a long few days. I’ll maybe listen to a podcast and fall asleep. Maybe read some?

Sifting through my blogroll I land on Every mother visits but mine via Azan. Finding you starts playing from my playlist. And from nowhere all memories of amma flash in my mind. Tears well up my eyes. I hold them back and pause the music. Doesn’t really help though. The post and the music maybe triggered those emotions? Or was it me thinking about her earlier this week during Diwali? Memories flash forward and backward like an old photo reel. I read somewhere memories are fickle. Each time you recollect something, it’s a variant of the actual. Your mind alters the recall very so finely that over time, your recall and what actually happened are way different.

I don’t want that to happen. Memories are all I have of her. And I don’t think I have any pictures of just her and me. I want to remember things the way they were at that moment. This is probably why I write about these fleeting moments?

When your close ones pass away, you don’t really miss them that very moment. You miss them at random moments and it whacks you real hard every single time. You’d think over time it’ll pass. But it fucking never does. ðŸ”—

item.title: 05 Oct 2025 14:30
item.description:
Between M&S taking ill earlier this week and the shutdown/furlough drama on Wednesday, last week whizzed by.

Joined the Poth’s for a game night on Friday. S and the kids watched Home while we played a bunch of games. Building your empire, Skyjoy, Really bad art, and that one real interesting game which we didn’t quite get to play…2100 and had to get S to bed to be ready for the Swim meet next day.

Reconnected with D. Konduru after almost 6 years. Time files!

You can’t tell people anything popped in my Rewind today. I don’t quite remember posting about this but I’m so glad I saved it in my wallabag instance. HabitatChronicles seems to be having a database issue and the site’s down.

S has gotten into rainbow looms. Keeps her quite busy but also generates A LOT of loom bracelets and rings.

Have had barely any time to tinker with stuff this weekend. S’s swim meet sucked most of Saturday and M was out almost all of Sunday for various things.

Prepped the two SSDs that I bought earlier this week. Should RSYNC backup my data files from the now almost 10 year old hard drive before it goes kaput.

Setup a Radicale instance in my homeserver and configured DAVx5 on my phone to tidy up all my contacts and calendars. While at it, I also installed and setup the FOSS Calendar app as the primary calendar app on my phone. Super slick and tidy! Should have made this switch way before…ðŸ”—

item.title: 29 Sep 2025 16:30
item.description:
And just like that three-quarters of 2025 is in the books!

Cameroon is gearing for its Presidential elections. They go to polls on October 12th and it’s almost given that Paul Biya, who’s been in power since 1982, will be elected as the next president. He’s rocking it at 92 years. Of the 30 million populace only about 8 million are eligible to vote (20 years and older). Historically, these elections have been mired with civil unrest’s and protests. The next few weeks will be interesting.

By tomorrow night, if the Congress fails to reach an agreement, we’re potentially looking at a shutdown. Beyond ridiculous that we seem to be at this juncture so frequently and living on continuing resolutions. This time around possibility of furloughs and RIFs [Reduction in Force] are highly likely. And then there’s also the drama that comes with it….

M most likely received her LNA invite. Yay! Looks like a training in December is a serious possibility. But again it’s never a given until she gets there and completes it. Adds a wrench to our planned December R&R and then a bigger wrench to how we handle bidding. 2026 is going to be beyond interesting. Choices, options, decisions and happy problems. ðŸ”—

item.title: 01 Sep 2025 21:30
item.description:
Just about winding down from the long weekend. Last week at work was super productive but also left me pretty drained by Friday. Working in a smaller shop comes with its perks but also brings in all the logistic hurdles. I’m guessing most of it is also got to do with us being in Africa. Travel logistics are a pain and the amount of admin overhead for getting actual stuff done is beyond bonkers. Decision memos, note-verbale’s, single entry visas, travel ticketing - always something that needs to be followed up on…

Family back in the states decided to rent a cabin in the Catskills and get some downtime. With photos coming in all weekend, definitely missed being there. Last time we did this in 2022, it was a 50 odd group and we had such a good time overall. One of those moments when you feel this is the tax you end up paying for choosing this career.

Exited a couple family WA groups that I’d joined in June/July to manage the air-ambulance for mummyjaan. Getting people off this wretched network is such a pain. I’m trying to find a decent interim - use it where absolutely necessary and GTFO as soon as the work is done. Feels like I’m beating the same drum to a deaf audience but I will stand my ground on this shit. Currently I have the app installed in my ‘work profile’ on my personal phone and turn it on only when really necessary.

Made some decent decisions on the financial front. With some liquidity, I think we now have a game-plan for some investments. Playing the long-game does seem to be making returns.

Took some time this weekend to upgrade my Trilium instance to the ‘Next’ version. Upgrade was painless. Major kudos to the new bunch of folks maintaining this real neat notes software. I do need to update a bunch of my notes here. Always an ongoing process! ðŸ”—

item.title: 31 Aug 2025 15:30
item.description:
Wasn’t quite a run, but was some good time outdoors. Last night M suggested I head out for a run the next day since the weather has been really good - overcast and quite breezy. This morning though, the sky was super clear and it felt relatively hotter than usual. Decided to still head out and so glad I did!

Besides taking all the ‘offshoot’ roads, I also ended up doing the whole loop. On the way downhill, besides a few stares here and there, it did feel decently safe. I did consciously get my earphones off though- just to be extra aware of my surroundings.

Feels good to be back on the roads after a couple months. ðŸ”—
